training_posts.content_bullets: Leadership stamina and work ethic, PM Modi's dedication, raising personal standards for nation building
training_posts.post:
I always thought I was a busy man. Until I experienced a day alongside Hon. Prime Minister Modi Ji in France ğŸ™

7 am we all were there for the Bastille Day parade and he had to stand most of the time.
12 to 5: Nonstop business meetings with all Business delegates from both countries.
Evening: We had a special dinner at the Louvre.
12 am onwards: There were fireworks at the Eiffel Tower.

After that, I was so tired. I popped a melatonin, and slept long.

But, the next morning when I woke up at 11, Modi Ji was already in the UAE, meeting government officials.

For years, we grew up believing that politicians don't work hard. That belief doesn't stand anymore.

When national leaders work with the same intensity (and more) of a startup founder, the least we can do is raise the bar for ourselves. Because building a developed India by 2047 will demand more from each one of us.

Happy Birthday, Modi Ji. Thank you for redefining what leadership looks likeğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³

training_posts.content_bullets: Manufacturing in India, boAt journey, Make in India movement, scaling production
training_posts.replacement_note: Replaced from 'Kapil Sharma Show' (celebratory) to 'Make in India' (factual-professional) for tone diversity
training_posts.post:
[translate:Phir bhi dil hai Hindustani] ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³

We were making nothing in India. We admit. There was no factory. No ecosystem of Wearables manufacturing.

But we took it head on. We had to do it. Our journey has scaled from 0 to 75% of manufacturing in India. 6 crore+ MKI products in 3 years and we are just getting started.

A big thanks to those who've supported us and also to the critics who have challenged us to do better.

A promise to the nation to only make it bigger from here. Taking India to the world.

training_posts.content_bullets: Investing time over money, mentorship approach, founder community, no-nonsense partnerships
training_posts.replacement_note: Replaced from 'Gen Z workplace' (500+ words reflective) to 'Investing time' (practical-mentorship) for shorter, distinct tone
training_posts.post:
For me, investing time is more important than investing money.

No, I have not invested in 100/200/400 companies.

I don't want to collect startups like they are PokÃ©mon cards.

And no, I don't decide where to invest based only on fancy acronyms like TAM/SAM/SOM.

I am not here to be "The guy who cuts the cheque!"

I'm here to be a mentor, guide, and partner a founder might need in their wild, entrepreneurial ride.

With the same spirit, we met a few of our invested founders over lunch :)

No suits, no formality. Just open conversations about the real challenges.

Founders brought up real challenges they were facing. And without hesitation, everyone pitched in with solutions.

This is what we are about. A founder community where people help people.

Because, let's face it, balance sheets might not have your back, but people will (Atleast some of them will, hold them tight) ğŸ’ª

training_posts.content_bullets: Overcoming fear of failure, personal growth through resilience, ego dissolution
training_posts.condensation_note: Reduced from 450+ words to 6-7 sentences. Preserves core insight while reducing verbosity and repetition.
training_posts.post:
Failure teaches faster than success ever will.

I failed CA. I failed multiple business ideas. But with every failure, my ability to try again only grew stronger.

I stopped caring about "log kya sochenge?" and started caring about "Am I trying enough?"

Fail once and see. The ego around failure will vanish.

Today, the same people who once criticized me proudly say, "Hum isko jaante hain!"

Success builds confidence. But failures give clarity.

You're down but not out, my friend. ğŸ˜Š

training_posts.content_bullets: India's startup ecosystem on global stage, Make in India movement, tech export leadership, France-India partnership opportunity
training_posts.post:
Honored to join Hon. PM Narendra Modi, President Emmanuel Macron, and global leaders at the CEO Forum with the backdrop of AI Action Summit representing boAt Lifestyle, Make in India, and our startup ecosystem on the global stage ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ğŸ™ğŸ»

Here's what I shared:

1. With over 100,000 startups, 100+ unicorns, and being the 3rd largest ecosystem globally, India is a powerhouse of innovation. It's time to connect the dots globally.

France should send its best minds to Startup Mahakumbh (April, Delhi), and India must show up at Viva Tech (June, Paris). We need more Founder-led partnerships in the future and France should also leverage programmes like Invest in India.

2. From Importing to Exporting Tech: There was a time when we relied on global giants for tech. Now, we MAKE and EXPORT tech, from boAt headphones to Apple iPhones.

Make in India is a reality. French companies can tap into this wave by partnering with Indian manufacturers, leveraging PLI/PMP schemes, and setting up joint facilities.

3. This forum goes beyond partnerships - it is a call for tech businesses worldwide to drive meaningful solutions for tomorrow.

We are building, innovating, and creating new possibilities for AI, Smart Manufacturing and tech.

And if there is one thing I realized, it is this: The world is watching India. But more importantly, the world wants to work with India

Jai Hind. The future is here, and it's MADE IN INDIA ğŸ”¥

Namaste and Merci beaucoup ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ğŸ¤ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·
